plot: While visiting colleges with Meadow, Tony spots a snitch. Carmela, meanwhile, discovers something about Dr. Melfi.

With Carmela home sick with the flu, Tony and Meadow head off to Maine visiting different colleges. They're having a good time and Tony is honest with her about what he does for a living. He's shocked however to see a one-time gangster, Fabian Petrulio, who some 12 years before testified against some fellow mobsters and is now living under the witness protection program. Tony decides he has to do something about it. Carmela gets a visit from Father Phil who ends up spending the night. She also gets a call from Dr. Melfi and learns for the first that Tony's doctor is a woman.—garykmcd

While driving up to Maine to visit colleges with Meadow, Tony spots a former family member who went into the Witness Protection Program after turning informant. While Meadow goes to her interview, Tony goes for revenge. Carmela, meanwhile, learns that Dr. Melfi is actually a woman, contrary to what her husband has been telling her. This drives her to seek comfort in the arms of Father Phil, who is already close to the point of returning her affections.—Jean-Marc Rocher <rocher@fiberbit.net>
